data.title: ABOUT — JEFFREY ROVNER PHOTOGRAPHY
data.text:
Jeff Rovner is a fine art photographer specializing in conceptual art. Through his photographs, he seeks to reveal order, beauty, and meaning in our chaotic world.

He is also the inventor of CONCEPT COMPANION, a tool to improve conceptual thinking.

Jeff was born in Washington, DC, in 1957. He earned his law degree from George Washington University in 1982. Before pursuing a full-time career as an artist, Jeff was a corporate attorney, technologist, and university professor. He is also a magician member of The Magic Castle.

Jeff’s artistic mentors have included photographers from the Magnum Photo Agency, National Geographic, and the Leica Akademie. Some of Jeff’s photographs are showcased in his 2016 book The Values of Le Petit Cirque, which includes a foreword by the co-creator of Cirque du Soleil.

He is a Board member and art exhibitor at the Laguna Beach Festival of Arts, a juried, annual two-month art show and performance venue that attracts more than 200,000 visitors each summer. He has exhibited his art at the Festival continuously since 2017.

In 2019, at the invitation of the United Nations, Jeff exhibited photographs from his Artificial Intelligence portfolio in Geneva, Switzerland, during the UN's AI for Good Global Conference. His work is held by dozens of corporate and private collectors.

You can learn more about Jeff’s artistic background in his VoyageLA profile.

Jeff shares a home in Laguna Beach with his wife and Theodore, their immense and unusually demonstrative cat. He (Jeff, not Theodore) looks forward to speaking with you.
